title: Font similar to the Chateau Latour font
content:
Hi, I’m trying to find a font in the same vein as the font used on the wine Château Latour. All suggestions are welcome.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [chateau.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090828032746/http:/typophile.com/files/chateau.jpg) | 26.19 KB |
author: mrpallarp

comments.content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090828032746im_/http:/typophile.com/files/lbl_FR_Latour_1981_jero_remc_6658.jpg)

Looking at the uppercase A’s there are some irregularities... perhaps a lettering artist did this?

Mramor is close:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/mramor/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090828032746/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/mramor/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/mramor/")
Thanks for the tip, but I’m looking for something that is a little more “stiff” if you understand what I mean by that. Mramor i a tad to elegant looking.
It has something that reminds me of Copperplate Gothic. But obviously much taller and thinner…
